page.title: 01A view of rural Sowerby.
page.content: This area is agricultural land, cut by a new arterial road and the main railway line between London and Edinburgh. The area is in the Vale of York, fringing the villages of Dalton, Topcliffe and Sowerby. The population of the block is involved almost exclusively with agriculture, which is mainly arable _ crops such as barley,potatoes and sugar beet. However,most of the farmers also have intensive stock rearing units holding pigs, barley bulls and poultry. The poultry rearing is by far the most significant,as there is a poultry processing factory nearby. The Cod Beck runs through the area North to South joining the river Swale at Topcliffe.
